document_metadata.name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the mammalian central nervous system (CNS) the nAChR plays an important role in synaptic signaling [3,4] and plasticity underlying learning, memory, and drug addiction [5,6]. Several nAChRs are strategic drug targets for neurological disorders such as schizophrenia and Alzheimer’s disease (AD) [7].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the mammalian central nervous system (CNS) the nAChR plays an important role in synaptic signaling [3,4] and plasticity underlying learning, memory, and drug addiction [5,6]. Several nAChRs are strategic drug targets for neurological disorders such as schizophrenia and Alzheimer’s disease (AD) [7].

Several nAChRs are strategic drug targets for neurological disorders such as schizophrenia and Alzheimer’s disease (AD) [7].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the mammalian central nervous system (CNS) the nAChR plays an important role in synaptic signaling [3,4] and plasticity underlying learning, memory, and drug addiction [5,6]. Several nAChRs are strategic drug targets for neurological disorders such as schizophrenia and Alzheimer’s disease (AD) [7].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the mammalian central nervous system (CNS) the nAChR plays an important role in synaptic signaling [3,4] and plasticity underlying learning, memory, and drug addiction [5,6]. Several nAChRs are strategic drug targets for neurological disorders such as schizophrenia and Alzheimer’s disease (AD) [7].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Agonist activation of a7 nAChRs triggers a cytosolic Ca2+ transient of varying duration and amplitude in different cell types. This transient commonly involves the release of Ca2+ from intracellular stores such as the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) (Ca2+ store).

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In immune cells where cholinergic signaling is known to play an important role in regulating cytokine release, nAChRs are thought to operate almost entirely through metabotropic rather than ionotropic modes [27,58].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Silent agonists, which convert a7 nAChRs to allosteric modulator-sensitive desensitized states without visible ion channel activity, appear to be effective in modulating nAChR activity in immune cells as well as in animal models of immune disease and inflammation [59].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Silent agonists, which convert a7 nAChRs to allosteric modulator-sensitive desensitized states without visible ion channel activity, appear to be effective in modulating nAChR activity in immune cells as well as in animal models of immune disease and inflammation [59].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Silent agonists, which convert a7 nAChRs to allosteric modulator-sensitive desensitized states without visible ion channel activity, appear to be effective in modulating nAChR activity in immune cells as well as in animal models of immune disease and inflammation [59].

Several nAChRs are strategic drug targets for neurological disorders such as schizophrenia and Alzheimer’s disease (AD) [7].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the mammalian central nervous system (CNS) the nAChR plays an important role in synaptic signaling [3,4] and plasticity underlying learning, memory, and drug addiction [5,6]. Several nAChRs are strategic drug targets for neurological disorders such as schizophrenia and Alzheimer’s disease (AD) [7].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: a7 nAChR-mediated intracellular Ca2+ store activation contributes to synaptic plasticity [14]; however, this mechanism is not limited to neurons because a7 nAChR-mediated CICR from intracellular Ca2+ store is documented in hippocampal astrocytes [15].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the presynaptic terminal, ion conductance through a7i appears to produce sufficient membrane depolarization to cause the opening of voltage-gated Ca2+ channels (VGCCs) which, together with direct influx of Ca2+ through the a7i channel and CICR, can foster a strong elevation of cytosolic calcium leading to the modulation of neurotransmitter release [29].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Such signaling depends on the ability of the Ca2+ store to engage calcium-sensitive regulators of the cytoskeleton, such as Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II (CaMKII) and calcineurin [13,40], which may not be fully activated by the a7i calcium current.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Such signaling depends on the ability of the Ca2+ store to engage calcium-sensitive regulators of the cytoskeleton, such as Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II (CaMKII) and calcineurin [13,40], which may not be fully activated by the a7i calcium current.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: This appears to be the case in microglia where direct interaction between the a7 nAChR and Gai promotes Ca2+ store release, leading to a decrease in the activity of p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) and reduced TNF-a release [64].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: This appears to be the case in microglia where direct interaction between the a7 nAChR and Gai promotes Ca2+ store release, leading to a decrease in the activity of p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) and reduced TNF-a release [64].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Similarly, in natural killer (NK) immune cells activation of the a7 nAChR by the selective ligand PNU282987 promotes Ca2+ release from the Ca2+ store, leading to decreases in nuclear factor (NF)-kB and interferon (IFN)-g production [65].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Similarly, in natural killer (NK) immune cells activation of the a7 nAChR by the selective ligand PNU282987 promotes Ca2+ release from the Ca2+ store, leading to decreases in nuclear factor (NF)-kB and interferon (IFN)-g production [65].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: a7 nAChR-mediated intracellular Ca2+ store activation contributes to synaptic plasticity [14]; however, this mechanism is not limited to neurons because a7 nAChR-mediated CICR from intracellular Ca2+ store is documented in hippocampal astrocytes [15].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the presynaptic terminal, ion conductance through a7i appears to produce sufficient membrane depolarization to cause the opening of voltage-gated Ca2+ channels (VGCCs) which, together with direct influx of Ca2+ through the a7i channel and CICR, can foster a strong elevation of cytosolic calcium leading to the modulation of neurotransmitter release [29].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Similarly, in natural killer (NK) immune cells activation of the a7 nAChR by the selective ligand PNU282987 promotes Ca2+ release from the Ca2+ store, leading to decreases in nuclear factor (NF)-kB and interferon (IFN)-g production [65].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: a7 nAChR-mediated intracellular Ca2+ store activation contributes to synaptic plasticity [14]; however, this mechanism is not limited to neurons because a7 nAChR-mediated CICR from intracellular Ca2+ store is documented in hippocampal astrocytes [15].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Calcium influx through a7 nAChRs can still however directly activate CICR from the ER of neurons [28].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In a human neuroblastoma cell line, nicotine-activated a7 nAChRs trigger CICR, producing changes in intracellular calcium levels that persist for up to 10 minutes as a consequence of both RyR and IP3 receptor (IP3R) function, the latter also linking to IP3R-mediated Ca2+ store release (IICR) [28].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the hippocampus and cortex, agonist stimulation of presynaptic a7 nAChRs by nicotine is associated with a strong increase in the probability of synaptic glutamate release [20].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: a7 nAChR-mediated intracellular calcium signaling at synapses on hippocampal CA1 neurons can also lead to increased glutamate release resulting in long-term potentiation (LTP) [23].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Calcium signaling by presynaptic a7 nAChRs therefore triggers both spontaneous and evoked vesicle release, and can contribute to short-term synaptic plasticity.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Taken together, the evidence indicates that presynaptic a7 nAChRs are positioned to regulate calcium signaling via direct calcium conductance of the open a7i channel and Ca2+ store release.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Signaling interactions between the a7 nAChR and the Ca2+ store can produce prolonged calcium transients and, in some cases, calcium oscillations in the soma, and, separately, in subcellular compartments such as axonal processes [38].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: a7 nAChR-mediated cellular calcium signaling is also a mechanism for activity-dependent gene regulation in neurons – by driving the activation of transcription factors such as CREB which play an important role in memory and learning [47].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, a7 nAChR signaling at somatodendritic sites regulates postsynaptic glutamate receptors [3,24], resulting in altered synaptic plasticity and GABAergic interneuron activity [25,26].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Agonist stimulation of a7 nAChRs results in a rapid influx of Na+ and Ca2+ into the cell via the open channel state (i.e., the ionotropic state: a7i) (Figure 1).

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Agonist stimulation of a7 nAChRs results in a rapid influx of Na+ and Ca2+ into the cell via the open channel state (i.e., the ionotropic state: a7i) (Figure 1).

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the substantia nigra, choline activation of presynaptic a7 nAChRs generates long-lived calcium transients that depend on Ca2+ store release, as evidenced by the finding that treatment with dantrolene, an antagonist of the RyR, diminishes this synaptic calcium transient [36].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Taken together, the evidence indicates that presynaptic a7 nAChRs are positioned to regulate calcium signaling via direct calcium conductance of the open a7i channel and Ca2+ store release.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the presynaptic terminal, ion conductance through a7i appears to produce sufficient membrane depolarization to cause the opening of voltage-gated Ca2+ channels (VGCCs) which, together with direct influx of Ca2+ through the a7i channel and CICR, can foster a strong elevation of cytosolic calcium leading to the modulation of neurotransmitter release [29].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Interestingly, long-term expression of the D44A a7 nAChR subunit also abrogated the ability of the a7 nAChR to modulate neurite growth in the same cell line, thus suggesting that calcium influx through the a7i state and Ca2+ store coupled release are required for proper a7 nAChR signaling [35].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: During hippocampal circuit development, for example, a7 nAChR-mediated CICR sustains crucial changes in synaptic strength leading to the maturation and refinement of neural networks [31,39].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: During hippocampal circuit development, for example, a7 nAChR-mediated CICR sustains crucial changes in synaptic strength leading to the maturation and refinement of neural networks [31,39].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Work by Role and colleagues nicely corroborates these earlier finding in cultured cells, and indicates that nicotine activation of a7 nAChRs elicits localized and oscillatory increases in intracellular calcium within axons of ventral hippocampal slices through IICR [38].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, a7 nAChRs are found to activate plasticity-associated kinases such as CaMKII at synapses through CICR and IICR in various experimental preparations including the chick ciliary ganglion, hippocampal axons, nerve terminals of the prefrontal cortex, and in the Drosophila giant fiber synapse [30,44–47].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: By involving the Ca2+ store, a7 nAChRs at the synapse can effectively engage a wide range of calcium-sensitive targets that are known decoders of calcium information (i.e., signal peak and duration). Such molecules include enzymes such as the cyclic AMP-dependent protein kinase (PKA) and CaMKII, which are calcium-sensitive and can regulate various synaptic ion channels, as well as cytoskeletal and trafficking proteins that govern vesicle mobility and release, and can also feedback onto nAChRs [41,42].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: By involving the Ca2+ store, a7 nAChRs at the synapse can effectively engage a wide range of calcium-sensitive targets that are known decoders of calcium information (i.e., signal peak and duration). Such molecules include enzymes such as the cyclic AMP-dependent protein kinase (PKA) and CaMKII, which are calcium-sensitive and can regulate various synaptic ion channels, as well as cytoskeletal and trafficking proteins that govern vesicle mobility and release, and can also feedback onto nAChRs [41,42].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, a7 nAChRs are found to activate plasticity-associated kinases such as CaMKII at synapses through CICR and IICR in various experimental preparations including the chick ciliary ganglion, hippocampal axons, nerve terminals of the prefrontal cortex, and in the Drosophila giant fiber synapse [30,44–47].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In fact, a7 nAChRs have been shown to promote an enhancement in presynaptic glutamate release in the hippocampus via their ability to directly activate adenylyl cyclase 1, thereby leading to cAMP-mediated PKA activity in the synapse [43].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Though direct Gbg coupling remains to be tested, it is consistent with electrophysiological findings that demonstrate a role for a7 nAChRs in the modulation of VGCC activity and neurotransmitter release in presynaptic terminals [71].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Though direct Gbg coupling remains to be tested, it is consistent with electrophysiological findings that demonstrate a role for a7 nAChRs in the modulation of VGCC activity and neurotransmitter release in presynaptic terminals [71].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: We have shown an important role for the G protein scaffold molecule, G protein-regulated inducer of neurite outgrowth 1 (Gprin1), in the targeting of the a7 nAChR to the growth cone in developing hippocampal neurons [53]. Once there, a7 nAChRs appear to operate through metabotropic G protein signaling, thereby directing cytoskeletal dynamics and contributing to axon growth (Figure 5).

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: We have shown an important role for the G protein scaffold molecule, G protein-regulated inducer of neurite outgrowth 1 (Gprin1), in the targeting of the a7 nAChR to the growth cone in developing hippocampal neurons [53]. Once there, a7 nAChRs appear to operate through metabotropic G protein signaling, thereby directing cytoskeletal dynamics and contributing to axon growth (Figure 5).

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Activation of the a7 nAChR by agonists such as choline, nicotine, or PNU282987 was found to produce strong calcium transients that last for several seconds while propagating throughout the growth cone [34].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In non-excitable cells, such as keratinocytes, a7 nAChR regulates cell motility through the activity of the Rho GTPase proteins CDC42 and Rac [85].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In non-excitable cells, such as keratinocytes, a7 nAChR regulates cell motility through the activity of the Rho GTPase proteins CDC42 and Rac [85].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In non-excitable cells, such as keratinocytes, a7 nAChR regulates cell motility through the activity of the Rho GTPase proteins CDC42 and Rac [85].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, a7 nAChR signaling at somatodendritic sites regulates postsynaptic glutamate receptors [3,24], resulting in altered synaptic plasticity and GABAergic interneuron activity [25,26].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Cytosolic calcium encodes information for cytoskeletal remodeling during neuron differentiation, migration, and synaptogenesis through amplitude, temporal, and spatial dimensions [79].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Cytosolic calcium encodes information for cytoskeletal remodeling during neuron differentiation, migration, and synaptogenesis through amplitude, temporal, and spatial dimensions [79].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Cytosolic calcium encodes information for cytoskeletal remodeling during neuron differentiation, migration, and synaptogenesis through amplitude, temporal, and spatial dimensions [79].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Cytosolic calcium encodes information for cytoskeletal remodeling during neuron differentiation, migration, and synaptogenesis through amplitude, temporal, and spatial dimensions [79].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Incremental increases in local cytosolic calcium concentration are often sufficient to activate pro-growth molecular activity, such as CaMKII activation, thus leading to actin assembly and axon elongation.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Incremental increases in local cytosolic calcium concentration are often sufficient to activate pro-growth molecular activity, such as CaMKII activation, thus leading to actin assembly and axon elongation.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: However, at high levels cytosolic calcium can inhibit growth through the activation of proteolytic enzymes, such as calpain, which sever spectrin, leading to cytoskeletal breakdown [80].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: However, at high levels cytosolic calcium can inhibit growth through the activation of proteolytic enzymes, such as calpain, which sever spectrin, leading to cytoskeletal breakdown [80].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: However, at high levels cytosolic calcium can inhibit growth through the activation of proteolytic enzymes, such as calpain, which sever spectrin, leading to cytoskeletal breakdown [80].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Presynaptic a7 nAChRs regulate the release of various neurotransmitters including dopamine, norepinephrine, GABA, and glutamate in a calcium-dependent manner [18,19].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Presynaptic a7 nAChRs regulate the release of various neurotransmitters including dopamine, norepinephrine, GABA, and glutamate in a calcium-dependent manner [18,19].

links.evidence: Presynaptic a7 nAChRs regulate the release of various neurotransmitters including dopamine, norepinephrine, GABA, and glutamate in a calcium-dependent manner [18,19].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, agonist application evokes calcium-dependent presynaptic potentiation at synapses, such as in presynaptic nerve terminals in the hippocampus and cortex, which is abolished in the presence of the a7 nAChR channel blocker a-bungarotoxin (a-Bgtx) [21,22].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the hippocampus and cortex, agonist stimulation of presynaptic a7 nAChRs by nicotine is associated with a strong increase in the probability of synaptic glutamate release [20].

links.evidence: a7 nAChR-mediated intracellular calcium signaling at synapses on hippocampal CA1 neurons can also lead to increased glutamate release resulting in long-term potentiation (LTP) [23].

links.evidence: Work by Role and colleagues nicely corroborates these earlier finding in cultured cells, and indicates that nicotine activation of a7 nAChRs elicits localized and oscillatory increases in intracellular calcium within axons of ventral hippocampal slices through IICR [38].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: These calcium oscillations persisted for up to 30 minutes after the initial application of nicotine, and displayed a signal that peaked at hotspots along the axon, which, incidentally, were also marked by the presence of the Ca2+-dependent kinase CaMKII.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Proliferation and cytokine release in T cells is also regulated by nicotine, which is driven by the ability of a4 subunit-containing nAChRs to directly couple to Gao subunits and signal through G protein-driven cell division control (CDC) 42 [61].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Calcium signaling by presynaptic a7 nAChRs therefore triggers both spontaneous and evoked vesicle release, and can contribute to short-term synaptic plasticity.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, a7 nAChR signaling at somatodendritic sites regulates postsynaptic glutamate receptors [3,24], resulting in altered synaptic plasticity and GABAergic interneuron activity [25,26].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, a7 nAChR signaling at somatodendritic sites regulates postsynaptic glutamate receptors [3,24], resulting in altered synaptic plasticity and GABAergic interneuron activity [25,26].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, a7 nAChR signaling at somatodendritic sites regulates postsynaptic glutamate receptors [3,24], resulting in altered synaptic plasticity and GABAergic interneuron activity [25,26].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the substantia nigra, choline activation of presynaptic a7 nAChRs generates long-lived calcium transients that depend on Ca2+ store release, as evidenced by the finding that treatment with dantrolene, an antagonist of the RyR, diminishes this synaptic calcium transient [36].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Taken together, the evidence indicates that presynaptic a7 nAChRs are positioned to regulate calcium signaling via direct calcium conductance of the open a7i channel and Ca2+ store release.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the presynaptic terminal, ion conductance through a7i appears to produce sufficient membrane depolarization to cause the opening of voltage-gated Ca2+ channels (VGCCs) which, together with direct influx of Ca2+ through the a7i channel and CICR, can foster a strong elevation of cytosolic calcium leading to the modulation of neurotransmitter release [29].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the presynaptic terminal, ion conductance through a7i appears to produce sufficient membrane depolarization to cause the opening of voltage-gated Ca2+ channels (VGCCs) which, together with direct influx of Ca2+ through the a7i channel and CICR, can foster a strong elevation of cytosolic calcium leading to the modulation of neurotransmitter release [29].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In one study, expression of the D44A a7 nAChR subunit, which harbors a mutation at amino acid position 44 that decreases the permeability of the open-channel state to calcium [33], resulted in loss of the ability of the a7 nAChR agonist choline to promote Ca2+ store release in a cultured cell line [34].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In one study, expression of the D44A a7 nAChR subunit, which harbors a mutation at amino acid position 44 that decreases the permeability of the open-channel state to calcium [33], resulted in loss of the ability of the a7 nAChR agonist choline to promote Ca2+ store release in a cultured cell line [34].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In one study, expression of the D44A a7 nAChR subunit, which harbors a mutation at amino acid position 44 that decreases the permeability of the open-channel state to calcium [33], resulted in loss of the ability of the a7 nAChR agonist choline to promote Ca2+ store release in a cultured cell line [34].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Interestingly, long-term expression of the D44A a7 nAChR subunit also abrogated the ability of the a7 nAChR to modulate neurite growth in the same cell line, thus suggesting that calcium influx through the a7i state and Ca2+ store coupled release are required for proper a7 nAChR signaling [35].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Within the growth cone, the ability of the a7 nAChR agonist choline to foster Ca2+ store release was essentially blocked by the IP3R antagonist xestospongin C, suggesting a role for phospholipid signaling in a7 nAChR-mediated IICR.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Activation of the a7 nAChR by agonists such as choline, nicotine, or PNU282987 was found to produce strong calcium transients that last for several seconds while propagating throughout the growth cone [34].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Agonist activation of the a7 nAChR with compounds such as nicotine, choline, or PNU282987 appears to be sufficient to activate cellular PLC and promote IICR in a Gaq- and dose-dependent manner [34,37].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the substantia nigra, choline activation of presynaptic a7 nAChRs generates long-lived calcium transients that depend on Ca2+ store release, as evidenced by the finding that treatment with dantrolene, an antagonist of the RyR, diminishes this synaptic calcium transient [36].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In the substantia nigra, choline activation of presynaptic a7 nAChRs generates long-lived calcium transients that depend on Ca2+ store release, as evidenced by the finding that treatment with dantrolene, an antagonist of the RyR, diminishes this synaptic calcium transient [36].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In a human neuroblastoma cell line, nicotine-activated a7 nAChRs trigger CICR, producing changes in intracellular calcium levels that persist for up to 10 minutes as a consequence of both RyR and IP3 receptor (IP3R) function, the latter also linking to IP3R-mediated Ca2+ store release (IICR) [28].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Such signaling depends on the ability of the Ca2+ store to engage calcium-sensitive regulators of the cytoskeleton, such as Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II (CaMKII) and calcineurin [13,40], which may not be fully activated by the a7i calcium current.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Such signaling depends on the ability of the Ca2+ store to engage calcium-sensitive regulators of the cytoskeleton, such as Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II (CaMKII) and calcineurin [13,40], which may not be fully activated by the a7i calcium current.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Work by Role and colleagues nicely corroborates these earlier finding in cultured cells, and indicates that nicotine activation of a7 nAChRs elicits localized and oscillatory increases in intracellular calcium within axons of ventral hippocampal slices through IICR [38].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Within the growth cone, the ability of the a7 nAChR agonist choline to foster Ca2+ store release was essentially blocked by the IP3R antagonist xestospongin C, suggesting a role for phospholipid signaling in a7 nAChR-mediated IICR.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In addition, a7 nAChRs are found to activate plasticity-associated kinases such as CaMKII at synapses through CICR and IICR in various experimental preparations including the chick ciliary ganglion, hippocampal axons, nerve terminals of the prefrontal cortex, and in the Drosophila giant fiber synapse [30,44–47].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In many cells, G proteins participate in the regulation of cellular calcium influx through plasmamembrane channels and from intracellular Ca2+ stores through G protein-driven regulation of store-operated calcium entry (SOCE) and second messenger IICR [62].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: These calcium oscillations persisted for up to 30 minutes after the initial application of nicotine, and displayed a signal that peaked at hotspots along the axon, which, incidentally, were also marked by the presence of the Ca2+-dependent kinase CaMKII.

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: By involving the Ca2+ store, a7 nAChRs at the synapse can effectively engage a wide range of calcium-sensitive targets that are known decoders of calcium information (i.e., signal peak and duration). Such molecules include enzymes such as the cyclic AMP-dependent protein kinase (PKA) and CaMKII, which are calcium-sensitive and can regulate various synaptic ion channels, as well as cytoskeletal and trafficking proteins that govern vesicle mobility and release, and can also feedback onto nAChRs [41,42].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: In fact, a7 nAChRs have been shown to promote an enhancement in presynaptic glutamate release in the hippocampus via their ability to directly activate adenylyl cyclase 1, thereby leading to cAMP-mediated PKA activity in the synapse [43].

links.evidence: a7 nAChR-mediated cellular calcium signaling is also a mechanism for activity-dependent gene regulation in neurons – by driving the activation of transcription factors such as CREB which play an important role in memory and learning [47].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: We have shown an important role for the G protein scaffold molecule, G protein-regulated inducer of neurite outgrowth 1 (Gprin1), in the targeting of the a7 nAChR to the growth cone in developing hippocampal neurons [53]. Once there, a7 nAChRs appear to operate through metabotropic G protein signaling, thereby directing cytoskeletal dynamics and contributing to axon growth (Figure 5).

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Recent findings also show that a7 nAChR coupling to G proteins promotes downstream signaling through monomeric GTPases, such as RhoA, which are intimate regulators of actin and cytoskeletal dynamics at the synapse (Figure 5) [35].

citation.db_name: Beyond the Channel: Metabotropic Signaling by Nicotinic Receptors.

links.evidence: Interestingly, recent findings reveal that polymorphisms in the RhoA gene correlate with smoking initiation and nicotine intake [87], suggesting that G protein signaling through the a7m state may contribute to (synaptic) mechanisms that underlie addiction in the brain.

links.evidence: Interestingly, recent findings reveal that polymorphisms in the RhoA gene correlate with smoking initiation and nicotine intake [87], suggesting that G protein signaling through the a7m state may contribute to (synaptic) mechanisms that underlie addiction in the brain.
